Entries.default: "You're right, he does do that with his hands!"
"Fye, 'tis roughing his precious spellybook that scares the lad! Or maybe 'tis notching his wee finger?"
"You gotta stop, my sides hurt! Ah, I missed this."
"Surely ye've spied how he's always brushing himself? He won't say, but he's afeared of seagull shat."
"Aloth, there any way you can bring Iselmyr back?"
"The whole point of suppressing her was to keep her out of my head."
"I miss her impressions. She could do this one of you..."
"Which she did over and over."
"Was real good, though. She could do all your twitching, your squeaky voice when you got nervous..."
"I heard you and Iselmyr again. I do wish you would stop encouraging her."
"Real sorry, Aloth. We'll keep it down."
"You think I care about your childish jokes?"
"What bothers me is how she dog-ears my grimoire. And you keep bringing her out."
"Just... looking to lighten the mood, I guess."
"What have you been up to, Aloth? Since we left Twin Elms."
"Quite a lot. I've been around the Eastern Reach, traveled to Old Vailia-"
"That right? Who took you there?"
"I'm perfectly capable of traveling on my own, you know."
"'Course I know that. Just never seen it, is all."
"So. Does Gilded Vale still reek of spoiled grain and burnt stew?"
"Wouldn't know. Decided to go places where I could be of more use."
"I didn't realize farmers were in such short supply in the Dyrwood."
"Not farming. Thought I'd take a shot at running things."
"...And those things are still running?"
"That really all you think I can do?"
"I meant no offense. You know how to handle a tankard, as well."
"Hey Aloth, remember back when you were a low-rank Leaden Key spy?"
"I generally try not to."
"Well you deserved the promotion. Much prefer you to your old boss."
"Why... thank you."
"I never thanked you proper for working to take them apart. I wouldn't have expected it from the Aloth I met in Dyrwood."
"Aloth. Hey Aloth. Iselmyr was just telling me this story about your school days."
"And I suppose now you're going to tell me about it."
"Is it true you woke your dormitory screaming in your sleep about a messy library?"
"Is it true Dyrwoodans don't raise swine for their meat?"
"Whoa. That's, uh... You know, forget I asked."
"Fye, if ye think the lad's fussy now, ye should've seen 'im as a wee one."
"Heh, that right?"
"'Twouldn't set foot in home or hearth without cleaning his boots. Slicked his breeches when he dallied."
"Well he's uh, he's changed since then... as I see it."
"Fye, Edér, d'ye have a spur 'twixt yer chaps?!"
"Sure, but you haven't noticed Aloth, uh, needing you less?"
"The lad needs me more than ever now't he's after the old Lead Key!"
"Guess you've been sleeping in there these past couple years then."
"I see yer gummies flappin' but 'tis only mush dribblin' out."
"You say so."
"-and the rest of the ale hall got right quiet! Lad was a ruddy sight then!"
"That's uh, that's something, I suppose. Hey, what would you say to me talking to Aloth for a bit?"
"Ooh, aye! See if he remembers that night! Ye... ye do mean to ask him, aye?"
"No, I just wouldn't mind talking to him right now."
"Aye, have ol' Iselmyr for a chuckle, then call up the lad when ye bore. I conne yer lark, Edér."
"Aloth, when you were handling the Leaden Key, did you get a lot of different opinions from folks?"
"The strange thing about the Leaden Key is that the members are so disconnected."
"Many have little idea of what the organization really does, much less who I am."
"How do you handle that?"
"The... headdress usually clarifies that last part."
"Most have little idea of what the organization really does, and they often have very different reasons for joining."
"How do you handle that?"
"Use enough big words, and most of them can be convinced you know something they don't."
"I must admit, Edér, I was initially surprised that you'd come all this way."
"You never struck me as... much of a traveler, but you seem to be flourishing out here."
"Then again, I suppose I've gotten to notice a lot more of late. With Iselmyr quiet, I mean."
"How is Iselmyr? Haven't heard from her in a while."
"You know, normally when she's angry, there isn't a moment of peace. This is a welcome change."
"Well, when you learn even the gods don't know it all, it's easier to take risks."
"Strangely liberating, isn't it?"
"Been wonderin'. Whit d'ye think ye'll say to the blue lad when we reach him?"
"Oh hey, Iselmyr. You really want to know? Didn't think you'd be interested."
"I dinnae conne much of the gods and their lot. But I do worry for a friend."
"Well, you don't have to worry about me. But that's nice of you to say."
"Iselmyr tells me you've been talking again."
"Yeah, guess we are talking more. Don't worry, though, nothing bad about you."
"I didn't realize she was conversant with anything else."
"You'd be surprised. She's been decent. Maybe 'cause I stopped responding to her when she's mean."
"I'd hate to think I've suffered another Awakening. Are you certain it's her?"
"Aloth, no matter what happens, we're not gonna let Iselmyr get between us, right?"
"You were the one who allowed her between us in the first place."
"Good. Because I wanted to ask you if I could court her."
"I do hope you're joking."
"Yeah, she told me to say that."
